channel.title: Refining NZ on Save Marsden Point
channel.description: Recent content in Refining NZ on Save Marsden Point

item.title: Public gifts Refining NZ \$2 billon hydrocracker
item.description: Refining NZ listed on the NZX in September 1962, received its first tanker of Kuwait feedstock in February 1964 and was officially opened by Prime Minister Keith Holyoake three months later. Refinery margins were government controlled. The original refinery was built as a simple hydroskimming refinery, which is a crude distiller unit with limited secondary upgrading. Prime Minister Robert Muldoon included the expansion of the Marsden Point refinery as one of his “Think Big” projects in the early 1980s.
